intro: Casearia iquitosensis, commonly known as the Iquitos casearia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland and floodplain areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
